turn.text: -- is that the basis of your contention?

turn.speaker: thomas_h_anderson
turn.label: Mr. Thomas H. Anderson
turn.text: No, sir.
No, Your -- Your Honor.
This Court has held that legislative determination of benefits come to this Court with the presumption of correctness about them.
I will not be and say that point.

turn.speaker: potter_stewart
turn.label: Justice Potter Stewart
turn.text: May I -- may I ask one -- I don't want to interrupt but I think maybe I can clarify, at least in my own mind.
Is your basic claim that you were denied due process procedurally because you were denied an opportunity to make this contention in the -- in the State of Florida?

turn.speaker: thomas_h_anderson
turn.label: Mr. Thomas H. Anderson
turn.text: That is the constitutional question, but it must be understood with the light of this statement, that actually, the question of benefits was tried by the Circuit Court and they found that we had received no benefit.

turn.speaker: potter_stewart
turn.label: Justice Potter Stewart
turn.text: Well, that was -- that was the purpose of my first question --

turn.speaker: thomas_h_anderson
turn.label: Mr. Thomas H. Anderson
turn.text: That's right.

turn.speaker: potter_stewart
turn.label: Justice Potter Stewart
turn.text: -- as to where the prejudice was.

turn.speaker: thomas_h_anderson
turn.label: Mr. Thomas H. Anderson
turn.text: But now, the Supreme Court of Florida says, in effect, that the Circuit Court never had any right to try this question of benefits because we had not objected in the administrative proceedings and taken a special case to the Circuit Court within 10 days.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: And is your -- is your answer to that answer is your -- do you deal with that by the contention that requiring you to do so within 10 days violates due process because it doesn't give you time enough, is that it?

turn.speaker: thomas_h_anderson
turn.label: Mr. Thomas H. Anderson
turn.text: We have raised that as one of our questions, --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Did you?

turn.speaker: thomas_h_anderson
turn.label: Mr. Thomas H. Anderson
turn.text: -- yes, sir.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: It's not one of your questions.
It's essential --

turn.speaker: thomas_h_anderson
turn.label: Mr. Thomas H. Anderson
turn.text: Well, it's sort of mixed in there.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Well --

turn.speaker: thomas_h_anderson
turn.label: Mr. Thomas H. Anderson
turn.text: I think there's two separate questions, whether we have the notice and whether the 10-day limitation is also a due process --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Yes.
Well, now --

turn.speaker: thomas_h_anderson
turn.label: Mr. Thomas H. Anderson
turn.text: -- Mr. Justice Frankfurter.
I'm not trying to dodge your question, sir.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: I didn't mean you -- I didn't remotely said you did but I just want to be clear.

If a state statute says that you must raise these questions of non-benefit within 10 days and you didn't do it, you could object to what has happened to you only if there were some constitutional vice in the limitation of the 10 days.
Is that what you claim?

turn.speaker: thomas_h_anderson
turn.label: Mr. Thomas H. Anderson
turn.text: I say that and I also say that if the -- if the department which imposed the burden had not also conferred a benefit that that would be a constitutional question which we would likewise have a right to.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: But you could have raised that question, you said, in the Circuit --

turn.speaker: thomas_h_anderson
turn.label: Mr. Thomas H. Anderson
turn.text: But we never had any notice, Your Honor.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: No, but the --

turn.speaker: thomas_h_anderson
turn.label: Mr. Thomas H. Anderson
turn.text: So, you can't raise something without --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Put the notice question aside --

turn.speaker: thomas_h_anderson
turn.label: Mr. Thomas H. Anderson
turn.text: All right.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: -- for a moment.
I understood you to say that in the Circuit Court, you could review and raise every question --
